passage:
(1) Medieval times were an important period in European history from about 500 to 1500 CE. During this time, castles were built across Europe as homes for kings and nobles. These large stone buildings had thick walls and towers to protect the people inside. Most castles were surrounded by a deep ditch called a moat, which was often filled with water. This made it harder for enemies to attack the castle.

(2) Knights were special soldiers who fought on horseback. They wore heavy metal armor to protect their bodies during battle. It took many years to become a knight. Boys started training when they were very young. First, they worked as pages, helping around the castle. Later, they became squires and learned how to ride horses and use weapons. Finally, after proving their courage and skill, they were made knights in a special ceremony.

(3) Daily life inside a castle was busy. The great hall was the center of activity where people ate meals, held meetings, and celebrated special events. Servants worked hard to prepare food, clean, and take care of the castle. Children learned useful skills rather than studying in schools. Most people ate simple foods like bread, cheese, and vegetables. Meat was usually saved for special occasions or eaten only by wealthy people.

(4) Although castles were built for protection, they were not always comfortable places to live. Many rooms were cold and dark, especially in winter. There was no electricity, so people used candles and fireplaces for light and heat. There was no running water, so servants had to carry water from wells or nearby rivers. Despite these difficulties, medieval castles were important centers of power and still fascinate people today.

questions.question: Which form of the verb is correct? They _____ television every evening.

Select the correct option. My parents _____ married for 20 years.

Choose the correct preposition. The book is _____ the shelf.
Which sentence is correct?

options.A: I usually drink coffee in the morning.
options.B: I drink usually coffee in the morning.
options.C: I drink coffee usually in the morning.
options.D: Usually I drink in the morning coffee.

options.C: She has lived in London since 2010.
options.D: She is living in London since 2010.

According to paragraph 1, what were castles primarily built for?

options.C: As homes for kings and nobles

questions.question: Based on paragraph 2, which statement is TRUE about knights?

options.A: They became knights immediately after training
options.B: They wore light armor for easy movement
options.D: They started training at a young age

questions.question: The word 'moat' in paragraph 1 refers to:

options.B: a deep ditch around a castle

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what was the great hall used for?

options.C: For multiple activities including meals and meetings

questions.question: According to paragraph 4, why were castles uncomfortable?

options.B: They were often cold and dark

questions.question: Which statement best summarizes the main idea of the passage?

options.A: Medieval castles were uncomfortable and dangerous places
options.B: Knights were the most important people in medieval times
options.C: Medieval castles were important centers of life and power despite difficulties
options.D: Medieval food was very simple and limited
